pageContext.claim: “We had mountain climbers come in to climb -- do you believe this? We had different samples put up and we had mountain climbers, literally, come in. "Which is the hardest one to climb?" The panel -- the steel panel on top makes it very difficult. It's called an anti-climb panel. I never thought I would be doing this for a living: anti- -- [Laughter] -- we built an anti-climb panel.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump claims "championship mountain climbers" tested a border-barrier prototype and found they could not scale it. But his claim has mystified professional climbers, according to The Daily Beast. "The country’s top climbers have no idea what the hell Trump is talking about," the report said. "Not a single person in the tight-knit community of world-class climbers had heard a single word about any border wall experiment." The Louisville Courier-Journal reported that an 18-foot replica built by a mountain climber found that it could be easily climbed. The replica "is being scaled not only by experienced mountain climbers, but by novices and young children," the newspaper said. "One climber even scaled it while juggling."
